headline: Aurora Triples Driverless Network to 10 Routes and Prepares to Expand Across U.S. Sun Belt
summary: PITTSBURGH, February 11, 2026--Aurora Innovation, Inc. (NASDAQ: AUR) announced it is tripling its driverless network with the launch of its latest software release, which also provides the Aurora Driver with the capabilities to begin expanding across the Southern United States and serve customer endpoints in 2026.

headline: Auto & Transport Roundup: Market Talk
summary: 1614 GMT – Lyft’s strategy around autonomous vehicles has some analysts waiting for more details.  AVs are both the biggest threat and the biggest opportunity for both Lyft and Uber, and while Lyft should benefit in general, Uber looks like it’s better-positioned as a partner for AVs given its larger scale and global presence, Truist Securities analysts say.

headline: Lyft Stock Crashes on Earnings. This Analyst Sees Upside.
summary: Lyft  shares fell by double digits after the ride-hailing platform disclosed a weaker performance than expected for the fourth quarter.  Analysts polled by FactSet had expected 29.5 million active riders and 256.6 million rides.  While that marked a 3% rise from this time last year, it also came in below Wall Street analyst estimates of $1.75 billion.

headline: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Uber’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Uber’s fourth quarter saw strong growth in users and revenue that aligned with Wall Street’s expectations, but the market reacted negatively to the company’s adjusted earnings per share shortfall. Management attributed growth to expanding monthly active consumers, robust adoption of new product offerings, and healthy demand in both core and suburban markets.
